metadata.title: CVE-2017-14102 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
MIMEDefang 2.80 and earlier creates a PID file after dropping privileges toa non-root account, which might allow local users to kill arbitraryprocesses by leveraging access to this non-root account for PID filemodification before a root script executes a "kill `cat /pathname`"command, as demonstrated by the init-script.in and mimedefang-init.inscripts.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14102` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphdefang - 2.83-1
mimedefang - 2.83-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mimedefang package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.83-1').
